example.source: get an A on a test in math

sense.description: C大调音阶中的第六音(或音符)

example.source: hire a car as a means of getting from A to B
example.target: 租一辆车作为从一地到另一地的交通工具

sense.description: 从头到尾；彻底地；完全地

example.source: know the subject from A to Z

sense.description: (同类事物中的)任何一个 [相当于any]

example.source: A car has a steering wheel.

sense.description: [用于专有名词前] 某一个

example.source: A Mr. Brown called just now.
example.target: 有位布朗先生刚才来过电话。

sense.description: [用于某些表示食物、饮料的物质名词前] 一份
[用于两件成套的器物或经常一起出现的物体前] 一副，一套，一组

example.target: 租一辆配有司机的汽车

sense.description: [用于dozen等表具体数目的词语前] 一
[用于few, good many, great many等词语前]

example.source: a great many things to do

sense.description: 表示“在…之上”，“在…之中”，“进入到…”，“至…”，“向着…”

example.source: We were completely taken aback by her rudeness.
example.target: 她的粗鲁使我们大吃一惊。
他放弃了医学改读文学。

sense.description: (不顾责任、义务等而)遗弃，抛弃

example.source: The lost boy abandoned himself to despair.
example.target: 迷途的小男孩陷入了绝望。

example.source: We abandoned ourselves to the beautiful scenery.
example.target: 我们沉浸在美丽的景色中。

example.source: The children ran on the grass with gay (或wild) abandon.
example.target: 孩子们无拘无束地在草地上跑。

example.source: They abased themselves before the monarch.
example.target: 他们在君主面前奴颜婢膝。

sense.description: 难堪的，为难的；羞愧的，局促不安的

example.source: The medicine did not abate her pain.
example.target: 药物并没有缓解她的疼痛。

sense.description: 属修道院(或曾是修道院)的教堂或房屋

example.source: I gave her an abbreviated account of what had happened the other day.
example.target: 我向她简单介绍了一下几天前发生的那件事。

example.source: Some abbreviation is necessary in order to save space.
example.target: 为节省篇幅，缩略一些词是必要的。

sense.description: 退离(王位)；辞(职)；放弃(权利、责任、要求等)

example.source: The King Edward Ⅷ abdicated to marry a commoner.
example.target: 国王爱德华八世为了娶一个平民而放弃了王位。

sense.description: 腹部(包括胃、肠及消化器官)
诱拐；劫持；绑架(妇女或儿童)
怂恿，煽动(犯罪行为等)；唆使

example.source: His wife abetted him in the deception.
The custom fell(或went)into abeyance decades ago.
example.target: 这种习俗几十年前就中止了。

example.source: They have held (或 kept, left) the question in abeyance for quite a while.
example.target: 他们把这个问题搁置了好一段时间。

phrase.word: The rule has been in abeyance since then.

sense.description: 这条规定从那时起便失效。

example.source: I abhor the idea of leaving this town.
example.target: 我真不想离开这个小镇。
他拒绝与平庸之辈为伍。

example.source: She has an abhorrence of snakes.(或She holds snakes in abhorrence.)

sense.description: 憎恶对象，最讨厌的东西(或人)
使人厌恶的，令人憎恶的，可恶的

example.source: We are all abhorrent of violence.

category.gram: [常与can, could连用于否定句或疑问句]

example.source: I can't abide that man - he's so selfish.
example.target: 我无法忍受那个人，他太自私了。

example.source: How can they possibly abide each other?
example.target: 他们两个人怎么可能相安无事？

example.source: The old man could never abide to be helped into the car.
example.target: 这位老人最受不了人家扶他上车。

sense.description: 遵守(法律、决定等)；信守(诺言等)
经久的，永久的；持久不变的

example.source: He has the ability to solve complex technical problems.
example.target: 他能够处理复杂的技术问题。

example.source: He has great ability in teaching physics.

phrase.word: to the best of one's ability (或abilities)

example.source: I will carry out your instruction to the best of my ability.
example.target: 我将竭尽全力贯彻您的指示。

usage.p: 用法说明
ability, capacity
ability 指实际表现出来的能力，这种能力可以是先天的也可以是后天培养的；而capacity则侧重潜在的能力(请注意这两个词有不同的搭配形式)，试比较：
Everybody envied him for his ability to speak several dialects fluently.大家都羡慕他有熟练运用几种方言的能力。
Her capacity for learning is surprising.她的学习能力令人称奇。

sense.description: 表示“能力”，“可能性”，“适宜性”
绝望无助的，凄苦可怜的；糟透的
奴性的，卑躬屈膝的；自卑的
郑重放弃(意见、事业、要求等)

example.target: 郑重放弃自己的宗教信仰

example.source: The forest has been set ablaze by lightning.
The whole building was ablaze with lights.
His face was ablaze with excitement.
The child is not yet able to talk.
example.target: 这个孩子现在还不会讲话。
他是个很有才干的律师。

example.source: select the ablest(或most able) man for the job
example.target: 挑选一个最适合做这项工作的人

sense.description: 一等(商船)水手；一等水兵

example.source: She was ably assisted by her colleagues.
example.target: 她得到了同事们的大力协助。

example.source: His father thought it was abnormal for a boy to be interested in ballet.
example.target: 他父亲认为，男孩子对芭蕾舞有兴趣是不正常的。

sense.description: 反常情况(或事物)；变态特征
在(船、飞机、车等)上； 上(船)；登(机)
在船(或飞机、车)上；搭乘船(或飞机、车等)

example.target: 我们上船(或上车、登机)的时间到了。

example.source: The plane crashed, killing 167 people aboard.

sense.description: (船、飞机、车等服务员对乘客用语)欢迎搭乘!

example.source: She took up her abode with her parents-in-law.

sense.description: 废除(习俗、法律等)；中止(制度)
主张废除死刑者；废除主义者；(美国的)废奴主义者
(天气、食物等)极坏的，糟透的；不愉快的
令人厌恶的东西(或人)；坏东西

example.source: That new building is an abomination.
Arrogance is an abomination to me.

sense.description: 土生土长的，土著(尤指澳大利亚土著)的；原始的

example.source: Our engine broke down, so we aborted the mission.
example.target: 我们的发动机坏了，因此我们中途取消了飞行任务。

example.source: She killed herself while trying to abort an unhappy baby.

sense.description: (计划、工程等的)中途失败；中辍的计划(或工程)

example.target: 我们的尝试结果失败了。
我们的尝试结果失败了。

example.source: Examples of this abound in her book.
example.target: 有关它的例子在她的书里比比皆是。

sense.description: 关于；与… 相关，以…为题；涉及

example.source: Have you read about the incident?
example.target: 你读过有关这个事件的报道吗？

example.source: About this time an incident happened.
example.target: 差不多在这时，发生了一件事。

sense.description: 在…身边；在…身上(或性格中)

example.source: She always has her wits about her.
She hasn't any money about her.
There's something funny about this guy.

example.target: 急急忙忙干自己的工作

usage.p: 用法说明
about, on
about 表示“关于”、“涉及”，on也有类似用法，但所表达的含义有所不同：用on时表示内容是严肃的或学术性的，可供专门研究这一问题的人阅读；用about时表示内容较为普通，不那么正式，多用在内容或观点比较通俗、一般性的情形。
a textbook on Chinese geography 一本中国地理教科书
a book for children about animals一本供儿童阅读的有关动物的书
a lecture on biochemistry一次关于生物化学的讲座
a conversation about money一次关于钱的谈话
an article on China's agricultural problem一篇关于中国农业问题的文章
an argument about strikes一场有关罢工问题的辩论

example.source: It's about time we left here.
example.target: 我们差不多该离开这里了。

example.source: books lying about on the floor

example.target: 我烦别人把我差遣得团团转。

sense.description: 沿相反方向；到反面位置
活动中的；在起作用的；在流行(或传播)中的

example.source: She will be about again soon.
example.target: 她不久就可以痊愈起床了。

phrase.word: not be about to do sth.

example.source: I'm not about to stop trying.

usage.p: 用法说明
about to, be going to
about to意为“马上就要”；“正要”。
We're about to set out.我们马上就要出发了。
I was about to go to bed when there was a knock at the door.我正要睡觉，忽然听到敲门的声音。
在美国英语里，not about to可以表示“不愿意”。
I'm not about to give him so much.我不愿意给他那么多。
be about to 这个复合助动词相当于be just going(或 ready) to do something 或 on the point of doing something, 含有“急促”的意思，不必加饰soon一类副词；但可以加饰由when连接的时间从句。be going to作“行将”讲时没有这类限制。
例如：
He is about to start.他快要启程了。(毋需加饰soon或者at once)
I was about to say something when your interrupted.我刚要开口说点什么，而你突然插起嘴来。
We're going to spend our holidays in Wales this year.我们今年将去威尔士度假。(可以加饰时间状语this year)

sense.description: 向后转(指操练动作)；(朝反方向的)倒转

example.source: do a sudden about-face on the policy
example.target: 在这项政策方面突然来个大转弯

example.source: hear sb. shout above the din
example.target: 透过喧闹听到某人高声喊叫

sense.description: (在数量等方面)多于；(在尺码、程度等方面)大于
(在等级、地位、重要性等方面)高于，优于

example.target: 他把荣誉看得比生命更重要。

example.source: The poem is above me (或my understanding).
She's above doing such nasty things.
example.target: 她不至于做出这等卑鄙之事。

sense.description: 在(或向)上面，朝上面；在头顶上

example.source: a strange noise coming from the room above
Write to the address above for further information.
example.target: 欲知详情，请写信给上面的地址。

sense.description: (在数量、等级、权力等方面)多于，大于

example.source: officers of the rank of colonel and above
example.target: 上校及更高级别的军官们

usage.p: 用法说明
above, over, more than
1 above, over和more than都可以用来表示“多于”或“超出”，三者同义、通用，都用于数量的比较，但在句中的位置不同：放在句首时多半要用more than，也可用over，但不能用above，例如：
More than (或Over) 2,000 copies were off press this year.今年发行了两千多册。
over通常用在数字和表示数量与长度的词语之前，但如果涉及高低的刻度就要用above，例如：
There were over 100,000 people at the pop festival.参加流行艺术节的超过了10 万人。
You have to be over 18 to see this film.你年满18岁才能看这部电影。
The temperature is three degrees above zero.现在的温度是零上三度。
另外，表示“高于最低水平或某一特定点”时用above，可以说：2，000 meters above sea-level 海拔两千米
Temperatures will not rise above zero today.今天气温不会升至零度以上。
2 表示“高于”(higher than)时，above(介词和副词)和over(介词)可互换使用：
The helicopter hovered above (或over) us. 直升机在我们的上空盘旋。
Flags waved above (或over) our heads. 旗帜在我们头顶上方飘扬。
3 表示职位高低时，above指级别高，over则指职别高。
The rank of ambassador is above that of minister.大使的级别比公使高。
The English ambassador is not over the French minister.英国的大使并不比法国公使高。(指职别)

sense.description: 所说过的，所提过的，所写过的

example.source: The above is how the system works.
example.target: 上述内容是有关这个系统的情况。

example.source: The above are supposed to come tomorrow.
She likes to be open and above board with others.
example.target: 她喜欢开诚布公地对待别人。

sense.description: 磨损(意志等)；(在精神方面)折磨(人)
朝同一方向并排地，并肩地

example.source: They walked two or three abreast.
example.target: 他们三三两两地并肩行走。

sense.description: 跟上(时尚、时代)，不落后于

example.source: keep abreast of the times in science
example.target: 跟上科学发展的时代步伐

phrase.word: keep abreast of the thought of the age

example.source: an abridged version of the novel
We try to keep our commercial secrets from being spread abroad.
example.target: 我们努力避免商业秘密被传播开来。
在暖和天气中到户外散步

example.source: The bus came to an abrupt halt.
The cashier absconded with an enormous amount of money.
His long absence from work delayed his promotion.
example.target: 他长期不上班耽误了提升。

example.source: an unexcused absence in a class
He took care of their house during (或in) their absence.
example.target: 他们不在时，由他照看他们的房子。

example.source: in the absence of a special contract
example.target: 在没有专门合同的情况下

phrase.word: Absence makes the heart grow fonder.

example.source: He was absent from his work without leave.
Snow is absent in some parts of the country.
example.target: 这个国家的有些地区终年无雪。

example.source: She absented herself from the meeting.

sense.description: 缺席者，不在者；在外房主
(通过邮寄等方式预先投给选举机构的)缺席选票
(尤指经常性的或非法的)旷工，旷课；缺席
(选票通过邮寄等方式预先投给选举机构的)缺席投票

example.source: He gazed absently into the fire.
example.target: 他心不在焉地盯着火看。

sense.description: 无约束的，独立的；专制的
(结构)独立的；(形容词或及物动词)不带所修饰名词或宾语的
完全地，全然；绝对，无保留地；从绝对的意义上

example.source: Oh yes, absolutely! It's certainly a great idea.
example.target: 太对了，这绝对是个好主意。

example.source: We absolved him from a promise.

example.target: 免除某人所承担的责任

example.source: Plants absorb energy from the sun.
I failed to absorb the full meaning of that remark.
example.target: 我没能吃透那句话的全部含义。

sense.description: 减轻(困难、打击等的后果)；缓冲

example.source: The carpets can absorb some of the noise.
example.target: 这些厚实的地毯能消除部分噪音。

sense.description: 使专心，使全神贯注；吸引…的注意

example.source: The TV program absorbed the kids completely.
example.target: 电视节目把孩子们完全吸引住了。

example.source: absorb the small states into his empire
example.target: 把诸小国并入他的帝国

example.source: absorb little shops into big businesses

sense.description: 专注；专心致志；全神贯注

example.source: the absorption of small shops into big businesses
A few MPs abstained from voting at the end of the debate.
example.target: 辩论结束投票时，有几个议员弃权。

example.source: The vote was three for, six against, and two abstentions.
example.target: 投票的结果3票赞成，6票反对，2票弃权。

sense.description: 抽象的，(语词等)表示抽象概念的
理论上的，纯概念的；不实际的

example.source: an abstract of a log book
consider a subject in the abstract
example.target: 从理论上考虑一个问题

phrase.word: I like pets in the abstract, but I can't bear this cat.

sense.description: 一般地说我喜欢宠物，但是我无法容忍这只猫。

example.source: abstract the idea of love from one's experiences
example.target: 从自己的经历中抽象出爱的概念

sense.description: 概括(书等)，做…的摘要(或梗概)

example.source: abstract sb.'s attention from his work
example.target: 转移某人对其工作的注意力

example.source: She sat there silent and abstracted.
example.target: 她坐在那里一声不吭地出神。
他讲话时常用抽象字眼。

example.source: In utter abstraction she almost forgot my presence.
example.target: 她愣了，几乎忘记了我在她面前。

example.source: This theory is too abstruse to understand.

example.target: 这些价格低得不可思议。

example.source: Coal is found in abundance here.
The fruit grow abundantly in this region.
example.target: 这个地区盛产这种水果。

example.source: It's abundantly clear what the result will be.
example.target: 结果会怎样是再清楚不过了。

example.source: She made it abundantly clear that no one was to interfere.
example.target: 她说得很明白，谁也不准干预。

example.source: Corruption is a major abuse in modern politics.
example.target: 贪污是现代政治的主要弊端之一。
你辜负了我对你的信任。

example.source: She got abusive on the phone.

example.target: 他们的土地和我们的土地相毗连。

example.source: plunge into an abyss of despair
the abyss between rich and poor
example.target: 穷人与富人之间的鸿沟

sense.description: 学问的，学究式的；纯理论的，不实际的

example.source: The prince acceded to the throne when the king died.
example.target: 国王死后，王子继承了王位。

sense.description: 答应，同意(要求，建议、看法)

example.source: He speedily acceded to her request.
example.target: 他迅速答应了她的要求。

example.source: Our government acceded to the treaty.
example.target: 我国政府加入了该条约。

example.source: The new car has excellent acceleration.
example.target: 这辆新汽车加速性能极好。

example.source: place an accent on the first syllable
example.target: 把重音符号标在第一音节上

example.source: He speaks with a strong American accent.
example.target: 他讲话带有浓重的美国口音。

example.source: She speaks in heavily accented French.
example.target: 她用浓重的异国口音讲法语。

example.source: The tight sweater accentuated his fat stomach.
example.target: 紧身的羊毛衫更显出了他的将军肚。

example.source: I've decided to accept the job.
example.target: 我已经决定接受这份工作。

example.source: He was charged with accepting bribes from a big company.
example.target: 他被指控接受一家大公司的贿赂。

example.source: They accepted him as a genius.
The police did not accept his story.

example.target: 这家旅店接受旅行支票。

example.source: He accepted the position as director of the department.
example.target: 他担任了系主任的职位。

example.source: His classmates gradually began to accept him as one of them.
example.target: 他的同班同学们逐渐地开始接纳他为班级的一员。

example.source: His proposal is acceptable to all of us.
example.target: 他的建议我们大家都能接受。

example.source: They would be acceptable as presents.
example.target: 它们作为礼物会很受欢迎的。

example.source: A humorous remark is acceptable to almost any one.
example.target: 幽默的话语几乎所有人都会欢迎的。

sense.description: 可以容忍的，承受得住的

example.source: His acceptance of bribes resulted in his arrest.
find(或gain, win, obtain, meet with)wide acceptance
example.target: 得到广泛认可；受到普遍欢迎

example.source: Her calm acceptance of pain impressed me enormously.
example.target: 她平静地忍受疼痛，这给我留下了极深的印象。

sense.description: 接近，进入；(人的)可进见；(地方的)可抵近
接近(或进入)的权利；接近(或进入)的机会

example.source: a hut accessible by a foot-path
example.target: 有一条小路可通达的小屋

example.source: The place is accessible to the public.
make a difficult subject accessible to the reader
example.target: 深入浅出地讲述一个难懂的问题，以便于读者理解

sense.description: 就任，获得(位置或职务，尤指王位)

example.source: on his accession to the presidency
after his accession to the throne

example.target: 对一项要求所表示的同意

example.source: The accession of 70 new students overcrowded this middle school.
example.target: 增加70名新生使得这所中学拥挤不堪。

example.source: the new accessions to the art gallery

example.target: (知情不报、隐匿或协助主犯的)事后从犯

example.source: be killed in a railway accident
example.target: 在一场火车事故中死亡

example.source: He has had a bad accident at work.
example.target: 他出了严重的工伤事故。

example.source: Our meeting there in such a far-away place was a mere accident.
example.target: 我们在那么远的地方碰到纯属偶然。

example.source: an accidental meeting with a friend

example.target: 他们自发地向英雄欢呼。

example.source: They acclaimed the film as the best one of the year.
example.target: 他们称赞这部电影是当年最佳影片。

example.source: He gained(或won)wide acclaim from his readers.

usage.p: 用法说明
across, over
1 across和over这两个介词，意思往往相近，二者均可用来表示“到达或处于一条河、一条道路或一条线的另一侧”。
The children walked across(或over) the road.孩子们过了马路。
She managed to jump across(或over) the stream.她设法跳过了这条小溪。
My room's just across(或over) the corridor.我的房间就在走廊对面。
They said they would be across (或over) the frontier by midnight.他们说，到午夜他们就已经越过边境了。
2 across和over均可表示“处于较高大障碍物的另一侧”，但为表示到达另一侧的动作，则只能用over。试比较：
If they can be across (或over) the fence before sunrise they've got a chance.要是天亮之前能到篱笆那边，他们就有了希望。
I saw him climbing very slowly over the fence.我看见他慢慢地爬过篱笆。(此处不能用across)。
3 across和 over均可用来表示“某一范围(如田野、沙漠、舞池)内的动作”。
There's someone wandering across (或over) the fields.有人在地里走来走去。但如果表示“从一定范围的一边到另一边”，则只能用across。
They drove across the desert.他们驶过这片沙漠。
此外，over一般不用于在三维空间(如屋子)进行的动作。
He walked across the room, smiling strangely.他从屋子这边走到那边，脸上露出奇怪的笑容。

sense.description: 离合诗(每行的首字母或末字母可构成词)

example.source: He was caught in the act (of stealing).
example.target: 他(在行窃时)被当场抓住。

example.source: She slipped and fell in the act of picking up the ball.

example.source: Her vehement protest was all an act.
example.target: 她激烈地提抗议，其实全是做做样子而已。

sense.description: 不可控制的自然力量；天灾
有条理地筹划；按部就班地做事

example.source: She was not really angry. She was just putting on an act.
example.target: 她并不是真的生气，只是在装腔作势。

usage.p: 用法说明
act
act 作为可数名词，与action 均表示“行为”，可替换使用。
People respect him because he always likes to do kind acts (或actions).人们尊敬他，因为他总是喜欢做善事。
It is a kind act (或action) to help the old man fetch water.帮助这位老人挑水是件善事。
请注意act与action的区别：act强调所做之事，常指片刻或短时间内所做之事；action强调做事的过程，可包含几项在短时间内所做之事。 具体、简易和短时的行动或动作，通常要用act来表示；抽象、持续和复杂的行动或动作则要用action来表示。
My first act was to run into the waiting room.我的第一个动作就是跑进传达室。
She is impulsive in her actions.她一贯做事冲动。 2 动词
描述人或事物的活动时，act与behave较接近，常指人的行为，也指事物在特定情况下的反应，而operate与function常指机器等的运转或人体器官的活动，也指这些活动所起的作用。
在疑问句当中，act作“反应”、“行动”解，用以询问行为特点。
How did the child act when you called him?你叫那孩子时，他有什么反应？
How should this powder act when mixed with water?这种粉末与水混合该起什么反应呢？
在陈述句当中，act常有状语来说明“行动”或“反应”的方式，有时还以形容词或分词作
为它的状语；但在特定语境中可单独使用。
He acted bravely when the house was on fire.房子着火时，他表现得很勇敢。
The medicine acts well.这药很有效。
He acted frightened.他一副受惊的样子。
Think carefully before you act.你要三思而后行。
act还可作“假装”解：
I can't take her seriously. She always seems to be acting.我不能把她当真，她似乎老是在装模作样。
act与介词as连用时，作“充当”、“用作”解。
A trained dog can act as a guide to a blind person.经过训练的狗可以充当盲人的向导。
act表示行动时一般作 不及物动词，但在某些习惯用法中，也可以后接名词作宾语。
3 act可用作及物动词，意为“扮演”、“演出”。
A new play will be acted in Paris next week.下周，巴黎将有部新剧上演。
Olivier has acted(the part of)Hamlet several times.奥列维尔已经几次扮演哈姆雷特(这一角色)了。
作“表演”解的act，是不及物动词。其主语为人；或者为戏剧名称，此时作被表演解。
He acted very successfully last night.他昨晚的表演很成功。
Hamlet is now acting in that theatre.《哈姆雷特》现在正在那家剧院上演。

usage.p: 用法说明
adapt, adjust
adapt与adjust的区别在于：前者可表示适应新的环境或条件；adjust则含有对具体事物进行精确的“调节”使其适应某一目的之义，侧重表示“(因客观环境或形式的要求而必须)适应”，常含经主观努力有意识或巧妙地适应某种情况之义。

example.target: 如果你觉得咖啡太浓，就往里面添点水。

example.source: I have added two names to the list.
example.target: 我在名单中加上了两个名字。

example.source: She added that I was wrong.
I have little to add to what you said just now.
example.target: 你刚才说的话我没有什么要补充的。

example.source: The little kid has learned to add and subtract.
example.target: 这个小孩子已学会了加减法。

example.source: The new movie has added to her fame.
example.target: 这部新影片使她的名气更大了。

example.source: That trip added greatly to her understanding and knowledge of the country.
example.target: 那次旅行大大加深了她对那个国家的了解和认识。

example.source: When we added in the cost of the drinks, the bill was over $120.
example.target: 我们把酒水算进去，账单上的数额是120多美元。

example.source: You forgot to add me in.
Add up these figures (或Add these figures up)now and tell me the sum.
example.target: 现在把这些数字加起来并告诉我总数。

example.source: Her story just doesn't add up. She must be lying.
example.target: 她的那套话不合情理，她一定是在撒谎。

example.source: These arguments don't really add up to very much.
example.target: 这些论据并不太说明问题。

example.source: My daughter is addicted to reading science fiction.
example.target: 我女儿是个科幻小说迷。

example.source: Many kids are addicted to computer games.
example.target: 很多孩子都对电脑游戏着迷。

example.source: overcome one's addiction to heroin (或heroin addiction)
The coffee will be less strong with the addition of some water.
example.target: 加一点水会使这咖啡不那么浓。

example.source: This is an indispensable addition to every office.
example.target: 这是每一个办公室都不可缺少的新用品。

example.source: There was a storm and, in addition, there was a power cut.
example.target: 除了暴风雨之外，还断电了。

example.source: She speaks German in addition to English.
example.target: 她除了英语之外，还会讲德语。

sense.description: (附在计算机主机上以增加功用的)附加装置

example.source: Please write to me at this address.
example.target: 请按这个地址写信给我。

sense.description: 地址(设备存取或寻径标识)
(在信封、包裹等上)写姓名地址；致(函等)

example.source: He addressed his complaints to the manager.
Mr Green will now address the meeting.
example.target: 现在由格林先生向大会发表演说。

example.source: address sb. without a title of honour
I addressed myself to all of you.
example.target: 我是针对你们大家说的。

example.source: He addressed himself to the writing of a novel.

sense.description: 引证，引用；举出(例证、理由等)

example.source: adduce data to reinforce the point
example.target: 引证资料来证实这一论点

example.source: He's a bit too old. But he's still adequate to the work.
example.target: 他岁数是大了点，但仍能胜任这项工作。

example.source: Her performance in the play was merely adequate.
example.target: 她在这部剧中的表演只能说是差强人意。

usage.p: 用法说明
adequate
adequate与enough、sufficient都可以用在名词前面，表示“(数量)足够”(复数名词前面只用enough和sufficient)。
We had adequate (或enough,sufficient) money for the journey.我们为这次旅行准备了足够的钱。
如果用adequate会被误认为表示“够好的(good enough)“时，就要避免使用。
There is sufficient (或enough) food.有足够的食物。
The children received adequate food.孩子们有相当好(或足够)的食物。

example.source: This kind of paint adheres to any surface.
example.target: 这种油漆能粘附于任何表面。

example.source: The teacher demanded adherence to the university's rules and regulations.
example.target: 老师要求(学生)遵守学校的规章制度。

usage.p: 用法说明
adherence,adhesion
这两个词均由adhere一词派生而来，意义上有些重叠。表示“支持”或“忠诚”时，用adherence较好；如果按字面意义作“粘附”解时，则以用adhesion为宜。
The teacher demanded adherence to the rules.老师要求遵守规则。

sense.description: (政党或活动的)支持者，投身者

example.source: give one's adhesion to a proposal
The fields adjoin to the highway.
The meeting has been adjourned until tomorrow.
The court was adjourned at noon.
The Senate will adjourn for the summer.
The meeting adjourned to the specified day.
example.target: 会议暂停，到指定的日期继续举行。

example.source: We then adjourned to the next room.
example.target: 然后我们到隔壁房间去(继续开会)。

example.source: He adjudged the stranger to be a little over 40.
example.target: 他断定这位陌生人有40来岁。
这个委员会被认为是不称职的。

example.source: The criminal was adjudged to death.
The house has been adjudged to the rightful owner.
example.target: 房子判给了合法所有人。

example.source: The court has adjudicated on(或upon) the case.

sense.description: (谓语、主语等的)附加语，修饰语

example.source: I adjure you to tell the truth before the court.
example.target: 我要求你在法官面前说实话。

example.source: I have to adjust my expenses to my income.
The seat can be adjusted to the height of a person.
example.target: 这张椅子的高度可以根据人的身高调节。

example.source: Some animals can adjust themselves to external changes very easily.
example.target: 有些动物能够很容易地调节自身以适应外界变化。

example.source: Adjusting to the summer heat was more difficult than we had expected.
example.target: 适应夏季的炎热比我们想像的还要困难。

example.source: The field glasses adjust with a screw.
example.target: 双筒望远镜是用一个旋钮调节焦距的。

sense.description: 即兴演出，临时插入(脚本中没有的台词)

example.source: She had to ad-lib the rest of the scene because she forgot her lines.
example.target: 因为忘记了台词，她在余下的戏里只好即兴表演。

sense.description: 管理(公司、政府事务等)；支配

example.source: The funds of the organization are administered by the government.
example.target: 这个组织的基金是由政府掌管的。
给受水灾群众发放救济

example.source: The administration of the law must be the same for the rich and the poor.
the administration of medicine to a patient

sense.description: 有管理(或组织)能力的人

example.source: It seems to be a most admirable idea.
example.target: 看起来这是个绝妙的主意。

sense.description: 海军司令；海军高级将领

example.source: His behavior claimed our highest admiration.
example.target: 他的行为值得我们高度赞扬。

sense.description: 引人赞美的东西；令人钦佩的人

example.source: He is one of my admirations.
example.target: 他是我最欣赏的人之一。

example.source: She is admired for her outstanding administrative ability.
example.target: 她由于出色的管理才能而受到赞赏。

example.source: They admired him for what he had done.
example.target: 他们对他所做的事情很钦佩。

example.source: I admired her for her fortune.
He wanted to drive his car and admire the view.
example.target: 他想开车出去观赏风景。
对你的厚颜我不胜惊讶。

example.source: Tom had admired Carolyn from afar for a long time.
example.target: 汤姆已经暗地里喜欢卡洛琳好久了。

sense.description: (能人或名人的)倾慕者，追求女子的人

example.source: The painter Turner was a great admirer of Byron.
example.target: 画家特纳非常敬慕拜伦。

sense.description: 可被容许的；(想法等)值得考虑的，值得接受的

example.source: Foreign products are admissible to the domestic market.
example.target: 外国产品被允许进入国内市场。

example.source: To give up now would be an admission of failure.
example.target: 现在放弃就等于承认失败。

example.source: He has the qualities for admission into(或to) the club.
example.target: 他具备进入该俱乐部的条件。

example.source: The admission to the concert is thirty dollars.
admission to the practice of law
On(或By)her own admission, she was responsible for the theft.
example.target: 她自己承认，这起盗窃案是她做的。

usage.p: 用法说明
admission, admittance
admission特别用来表示被允许进入公共建筑物或公共场所(如：医院学校等)，admittance经常用来表示被允许进入私人建筑物或场所。在“准许进入”这个意义上，admission更为通用一些。
admission用于抽象意义(例如准许入会成为会员)，也可以表示“入场券(价格)”或者“承认”，但admittance没有这些义项。
Your application for admission to the society has been approved.你的入会申请已获批准。
Admission to the show is two dollars.这次演出的入场券每张两美元。
His admission that he was to blame kept the others from being punished.他承认自己难辞其咎，从而避免了别人受罚。

example.source: The soldiers refused to admit defeat.
The thief had to admit stealing the gold watch.
example.target: 小偷不得不承认偷了金表。

example.source: We must admit the work to be difficult.
example.target: 我们必须承认这项工作很困难。
他终于承认自己被打败了。

example.source: You must admit that she was right.

sense.description: 接纳，容许进入(某地、某范畴)，容许享受(某种特权)

example.source: Jane was admitted to the bar.
They admit to having taken time off when they were not ill.
Mary admits to the age of forty.
The current situation does not admit of this.
The road admits to the Great Wall Hotel.

sense.description: 即便…是确实的，假设…是事实

example.source: Admitting that she was right, it would be impossible for us to do it.
example.target: 即便她是对的，我们也不可能去做。

usage.p: 用法说明
admit
1 admit 与acknowledge的含义较接近，都作“承认”解，但表示“虽不愿意却不得不承认(某一事实)”，承认的原因可能是与外界的压力有关，也可能是出于理智的考虑，例如：
They had to admit that.他们不得不承认那一点。
而 acknowledge则不含此义。
在作及物动词时，其句法也与acknowledge相似，其后可接名词或动名词作宾语；也可接宾语加补语的复合结构。
The soldiers refused to admit defeat.士兵们不肯承认失败。
The thief had to admit stealing the gold watch.小偷不得不承认偷了金表。
We must admit the work to be difficult. 我们必须承认这项工作很困难。
He finally admitted himself beaten.他终于承认自己被打败了。
I admit that the work is difficult.我承认这项工作很难。
2 admit有时用于插入语中，表示“承认”，但语气较弱。
What he said at the meeting, I admit, is quite true.我承认，他在会上所说的确是真的。 3 admit用作不及物动词时，与介词to搭配，表示“承认(某一事实)”。
I have to admit to a dislike for modern music.我得承认我不喜欢现代音乐。

example.source: She is admittedly a great singer.
example.target: 她是一位公认的大歌唱家。

example.source: Admittedly, this is a difficult subject, but most of us can master it.
example.target: 诚然，这是个很难的学科，但我们大多数人都能学好。

example.source: an admixture of flour and water
The teacher admonished the students against smoking.
example.target: 老师告诫学生们不要吸烟。

example.source: admonish sb. of the impending danger
example.target: 就即将发生的危险警告某人

example.source: She admonished him of his obligation.
The quarrel was far too much ado about nothing.
example.target: 这场争吵只不过是无事生非而已。

example.source: So without further ado, we will discuss the next topic.
example.target: 要没别的事，我们便继续讨论下一个题目。

sense.description: 采纳，采用(政策、想法、意见等)

example.source: The committee ultimately adopted his suggestions.
example.target: 委员会最终采纳了他的建议。
众议院通过了一项议案。

example.source: We adore her for her excellent skills.
example.target: 我们因为她的高超技艺而敬佩她。

example.source: The wall is adorned with paintings.

example.target: 他的房子装饰得富丽堂皇。

example.source: His appropriate action adorned his speech.
example.target: 他那恰到好处的动作为其演说增色不少。

example.source: That little bag is a lovely adornment.
example.target: 那个小包是个可爱的装饰品。

example.source: The girls were busy with the adornment of the room.
example.target: 女孩子们在忙着装饰房间。

example.source: The ship was adrift on the sea.
example.target: 船在海上毫无目标地漂着。

example.source: Though you have explained, I am still all adrift.
example.target: 虽然你已经解释过了，我还是不明白。

example.source: The government will thus be set adrift.
example.target: 政府将因此被弄得岌岌可危。

sense.description: (身体、心智)发育成熟的，成年的

example.source: You are adult enough to know what you should do.
example.target: 你这么大了，应该知道自己该做什么。

example.source: The boy behaves in an adult way.
example.target: 这个男孩的举止像个大人。

example.source: The milk has been adulterated with water.

sense.description: 暗示；预示；勾划出…的轮廓

example.source: The local festival pattern was adumbrated in the seventeenth century.
example.target: 当地的这种节日风俗于17世纪初步形成。

example.source: The rain didn't adumbrate his mood.
example.target: 大雨并没有影响他的情绪。

example.source: a striking advance in the realm of the natural sciences
example.target: 自然科学领域里的惊人进步

example.source: The inflation caused an advance in the price of rice.
example.target: 通货膨胀导致米价上涨。

example.source: He has been advanced from a lectureship to a professorship.
example.target: 他已从讲师晋升为教授。
我只不过是提出一种可能性而已。

example.source: advance the date of the contest
Our army advanced against the enemy.
By 35, he had already advanced to colonel.
the advance section of a plane
an advance text of a speech

usage.p: 用法说明
advance
1 该词作为形容词，意为“先期的，在前的”；不同于advanced(高级的，先进的)。
The advance troops have sighted the enemy.先头部队已经发现了敌人。
He is spending a year in advanced studies.他正在进行为期一年的进修。
2 该词作为名词，意为“进步”，与advancement(升级，晋升)不同，请比较：
Remarkable advances have been made in space travel in recent years.近几年来，宇航方面已经取得长足的进步。
His advancement to captain came the following year.又过了一年，他才晋升为上尉。

example.source: Their regiment are in an advanced position.
example.target: 他们团占据了一处前沿阵地。

sense.description: (思想、态度等)开明的；标新立异的

example.source: My grandfather lived to the advanced age of 90.
a job with opportunities for advancement
The book has the advantage of brevity.
give sb. an advantage over his opponent
example.target: 使某人比自己的对手占有优势

example.source: They are seeking some kind of commercial advantage.
example.target: 他们正在谋取某种商业上的利益。

example.source: Is there any advantage in getting there early?
example.target: 早到那儿有什么好处吗？

sense.description: 处于有利地位；以优越的条件

example.source: a trade agreement advantageous to both countries
example.target: 对两国都有利的贸易协定

example.source: It is highly advantageous to them.

sense.description: 圣诞前的时间；降临节；基督的降临
(尤指不寻常的人或事情的)到来，降临

example.source: Society has changed rapidly since the advent of the computer.
example.target: 自从计算机问世以来，社会发生了迅速的变化。

sense.description: 为商业冒险提供资金者
有进取心的；敢作敢为的
对手的，敌手的；对抗性的

example.target: 他是一个旗鼓相当的对手。

example.source: The judgment was adverse to him.
He adverted to the need of a rise in the pay for teachers.
example.target: 他谈到给教师增加工资的必要性。

example.source: The boy went on speaking without adverting to the interruption.
example.target: 这个男孩不顾打扰继续往下说。

example.source: They advertised their goods for sale extensively.
example.target: 他们为推销产品而大做广告。

sense.description: (在报刊、电视、广播中)公布(启事)

example.source: The departure of the President has been officially advertised.
example.target: 总统的离去已经正式公布。

example.source: advertise a child as lost in the newspaper
example.target: 在报上刊登走失小孩的启事

example.source: The girl wore a tight dress to advertise her figure.
example.target: 这个女孩子穿了一件紧身的衣服，以显示自己的身材。
把自己的意思告知某人

example.source: He advertised for a house to rent.
The school advertised on a blackboard.
The paper contains ten columns of advertisements.
example.target: 这份报纸有10个广告专栏。

example.source: The shop secured a lot of customers by advertising.
example.target: 这家商店用广告吸引了许多顾客。

example.source: a company that does big advertising
example.target: 经营大规模广告生意的公司

example.source: He followed the doctor's advice literally.
example.target: 他一字不差地遵从医生的建议。

example.source: Can you give me some advice about the matter?
example.target: 你能就此事给我提些意见吗？

example.source: I came here for your advice.

sense.description: (尤指远方来的)消息，情报；报道

example.source: the latest advices from our London agent
example.target: 来自伦敦代理人的最新消息

example.source: We have received your advice of shipment.
example.target: 我方已收到你方的装船通知。

example.source: It's advisable that you go about the task with a clear plan in mind.
example.target: 你们着手做时最好心里有个明确的计划。

example.source: I advised that steps be taken right away.
John will advise you on training the new team.
example.target: 约翰会就训练新团队的事向你提供建议。

example.source: They advised him against saying anything to the school.
example.target: 他们劝他不要告诉学校任何事。

example.source: Please advise us of any change of your telephone number.
example.target: 如电话号码有变，敬请通知我们。

example.source: He advised with his friends on the plan.
example.target: 他与朋友商量这个计划。

example.source: Mary will act as you advised.
example.target: 玛丽将按照你的意见行事。

example.source: He always spoke advisedly after lengthy consideration.
example.target: 他总是经过长时间周密思考，而后才胸有成竹地讲话。

sense.description: 提供意见者；(尤指正式的)顾问

example.source: He served as law adviser to the firm.
example.target: 他做过这家公司的法律顾问。
建议(或劝告性)车速标记

example.source: zealous advocacy of the women's lib
example.target: 热忱支持妇女解放运动

example.source: We all passionately advocate economic reforms.
example.target: 我们都热烈拥护经济改革。
极端主义分子公开鼓吹暴力。

example.source: He is an advocate of early rising.
an earnest advocate of the idea
example.target: 这一主张的热心倡导者

example.source: remove the U.N. aegis from the U.S. troop presence in South Korea
example.target: 撤去美国在南朝鲜驻军所打的联合国旗号

sense.description: 在…的保护下；在…的庇护下；由…主办或发起

example.source: under the aegis of the government

phrase.word: under the unfailing aegis of law

sense.description: 在法律的可靠保护之下
极漫长的时期；一个时代

example.source: He recalled the talk with his mother aeons ago.
example.target: 他回忆起许久以前跟妈妈的谈话。

sense.description: 向(液体中)充以二氧化碳
使暴露于空气中；使充气
需氧的，生存于氧气中的
航空与航天的；航空与航天器的

example.source: He saw the boy from afar.
example.target: 他远远地看到了那个男孩。

sense.description: 易接近的；(对下属)谦虚有礼的

example.source: Professor Li is always affable to his students.
example.target: 李教授对学生们总是和蔼可亲。

example.source: They have no right to interfere with the internal affairs of China.
example.target: 他们无权干涉中国内政。

sense.description: 社会轶闻；闹得满城风雨的事件

example.source: a settler in an unpleasant affair
example.target: 一桩不快事件的调停者

example.source: Supper was a very American affair.

sense.description: 恋爱事件；(尤指关系不长的)风流韵事

example.source: The wedding was a grand affair.
indirectly affected the living of the people
I was deeply affected by the movie.
example.target: 我被这部电影深深打动了。

example.source: The old man was much affected at the news.
example.target: 这消息使老人大受震动。
那个男人装作无动于衷的样子。

example.source: My mother was affected with high fever yesterday.
This is the desk he affects.
example.target: 这是他特别喜欢的桌子。

example.source: affect a direct way of speaking
I made an affectation of interest.
example.target: 我假装出感兴趣的样子。

example.source: The girl spoke in an affected way.
example.target: 那个女孩说起话来矫揉造作。

example.source: I was well affected toward my English teacher.
example.target: 我对我的英语老师特别有好感。

sense.description: 令人感动的；激起怜悯的

example.source: It was a deeply affecting story.
example.target: 这是一个特别令人感动的故事。

example.source: He tried every way to gain her affcetion.
example.target: 他想方设法想得到她的爱情。

example.source: Sue kept her affection for her husband to the end of her life.
example.target: 苏终身保持着对丈夫的爱。

example.source: My father does not show much affection for (或 towards) dogs.

usage.p: 用法说明
affection
affection 意为“钟爱之情”或者“疾病”；而affectation意为“装模作样”。二者容易混淆，试比较：
He shows much affection for his cat.他对自己的猫宠爱有加。
He is suffering from an affection of the throat and coughs severely.他咽部有病，咳嗽得很厉害。
His affectations are insufferable.他这人装模作样，让人无法忍受。

example.source: She was very affectionate to his brother.
The two schools were affiliated by the Church.
example.target: 这两所学校因与教会有关系而联系密切。
把《哈姆雷特》归入早期戏剧

sense.description: 判定(非婚生子女的)父亲

example.source: affiliate a child to his father
He refused to affiliate with the club.
example.target: 他拒绝参加这个俱乐部。
全体成员都出席了这次会议。

sense.description: 从属(某一政治、宗教团体的)关系；联系

example.source: He soon developed a strong affinity for Chinese.
The manager has established a kind of affinity beween himself and his subordinates.
example.target: 经理已经与下属建立了密切关系。

example.source: There is an affinity between English and French.
example.target: 英语和法语有相似的地方。

example.source: the affinity between A and B
affirm the truth of a statement
example.target: 断言某一说法确凿无误
委员会通过了这项决议。

example.source: I do not feel affirmative about it.

sense.description: (鼓励雇用少数民族成员及妇女等的)积极措施；赞助性行动

example.source: The government should take affirmative action to hire the handicapped.
example.target: 政府应采取措施鼓励雇用残疾人。

example.source: affix a label to a bottle
He affixed his signature to an agreement.
affix a seal to an instrument

sense.description: 使(体力或精神上)受折磨

example.source: He was sorely afflicted at the failure.
example.target: 他为那次失败感到痛苦不已。

example.source: I am affluent with the month's wages.
example.target: 有了月底的工资，我手头宽裕了。

example.source: I can not afford to lose my job.

example.target: 上帝会赐给他永恒的安息。

example.source: She was charged with causing an affray.

example.target: 她看上去像是受了谁的侮辱。

sense.description: 阿富汗毛毯；阿富汗披肩

example.source: The remarks carried us far afield.
example.target: 这话使我们离题太远了。

example.source: The mountain is aflame with the crimson maple.

example.target: 我们因为好奇而坐立不安。

example.source: The ship afloat now is an oil tank.
example.target: 现在在水上漂浮着的是一艘油轮。

sense.description: 经济上应付自如的，无债务的

example.target: 把一份岌岌可危的杂志维持下去

example.source: I come here all the way afoot.
He seems very afraid of losing the job.
example.target: 他似乎很害怕丢掉这份工作。

example.source: Don't be afraid to ask questions.
The girl is afraid of thunder.

sense.description: 恐怕(有礼貌地表示惋惜)

usage.p: 用法说明
afraid
1 与fear相比，be afraid (of) 在非正式场合下要常用得多。
Don't be afraid.别害怕。
Are you afraid of the dark? 你害怕黑暗吗？(人们日常生活中一般不会说Do you fear the dark?)
I'm afraid的意思往往相当于I'm sorry, but...，用来引出带有歉意地回绝或是引出不好的消息等。
I'm afraid I can't help you.我恐怕帮不了你的忙。
I'm afraid your wife's had an accident.你的夫人恐怕遇上意外了。
I'm afraid not和I'm afraid so常用作答语。
-Can you lend me a pound?你能借给我一英镑吗？
-I'm afraid not.恐怕不行。
Yes, I'm afraid so.恐怕是的。
2 afraid前面不能使用程度副词very,但可以用very much(特别是表达I'm sorry之义时)。
I'm very much afraid he's out.非常抱歉，他不在家。
3 be afraid of doing something和be afraid to do something都作“恐怕”或“生怕”讲，但侧重点各不相同：前者所考虑的是后果，而后者所考虑的则是条件。
The mother was afraid of waking her baby up.母亲生怕吵醒小宝宝。(因为小宝宝病了，需要多睡一会儿)
The mother was afraid to wake her baby up. 母亲生怕吵醒小宝宝。(因为小宝宝被吵醒后，会哭个不停)

usage.p: 用法说明
ago, before
1 用在表示时间的词之后，和过去式连用而不能与现在完成式连用。
He called you up ten minutes ago.他10分钟前曾打电话给你。
2 ago要用于过去式，以现在为准，表示“现在的多长时间以前”；before则用于过去完成时，以过去为准，表示“过去某时的多长时间以前”。
I started working for this firm three years ago.我是3年前开始在这家公司工作的。
Two years ago, I left the company that I had joined two years before.两年前，我离开了已经连续服务两年的公司。

usage.p: 用法说明
aid
表示“(为公共事业所提供的)正式且较大的物资和经济援助”，不同于一般性的help。可是能用help时，不要轻易使用aid。
aid to the developing countries 对发展中国家的援助
aid 表示“助手”时，使用范围不如aide广(aide广泛用于军事、医疗护理、福利事业和外交事务中，美国英语中甚至用以指内阁部长级的高级行政官员)。

usage.p: 用法说明
ain't
该缩略形式可代表am not，are not，is not，have not，has not。标准英语(无论英国英语还是美国英语)中并不使用这一形式，但在方言和未接受教育者的语言当中十分常见。讲美国英语的人，即使受过教育的人也喜欢在非正式的谈话中使用这一形式(尤其是派生形式ain't I)。

usage.p: 用法说明
allow
与稍微正式一些的permit(允许)相比，allow较常见于非正式的英语当中。allow经常用于被动式，但应注意：allow的被动式不能以it 为形式主语。
People are not allowed to smoke in the cinema.影院里不允许人们吸烟。
Smoking is not allowed in the cinema.影院里不准吸烟。

sense.description: (为法律、规则、习俗等)允许的，准许的，许可的，容许的
(定期)给予物或给予额；允许额，限额

example.source: The baggage allowance is 75 pounds per person.
an allowance on your old cooker
Dad is under a lot of pressure, so we must make allowances for him.
example.target: 爸爸的压力很大，我们应当体谅他的难处。

usage.p: 用法说明
alone
alone不像 lonely 那样代表孤独之感，只是陈述独自一人的客观事实。在口语中常为on one's own所代替，但后者更强调“没有别人(的帮助)或者无需别人帮忙”。试比较：
He built the house on his own!他靠自己一个人就盖起了这座房子!
He built the house alone.他自己一个人盖的房子。

usage.p: 用法说明
always
1 always 一般与动词连用，不用于句子开头(但可以用于祈使句的句首)，例如：
I always ask myself why I came here.我一直在问自己为什么来这儿。
Always be active in class.课堂上要始终保持积极主动。
2 如果always 用来表示从过去到现在的一段时间，通常与现在完成时连用。
Michael has always been my closest friend.麦克尔一向都是我最亲密的朋友。
3 always表示总是如此或毫无例外时，动词通常不能用进行时；在讲到事情经常发生而且(很有可能)令人惊讶或令人讨厌时，动词要用进行时形式，例如：
The sun always rises in the east. 太阳永远从东方升起。
She is always making troubles.她总是在惹麻烦。

usage.p: 用法说明
ammunition, munition
ammunition 指从武器中射出的任何东西(如弹头、弹壳、导弹、气枪弹丸等)以及炸弹、地雷和手榴弹等，而munition则指兵工厂生产的军需品，也就是说除弹药之外还包括枪械。另外，ammunition可在修辞手段中用作比喻，例如：
His improper speech provides ammunition for his opponents.他发表的不当言论使他受到对手的抨击。

sense.description: 变形虫的；变形虫性的；变形虫引起的
在…之间，在范围之内(均分)

example.source: We can lift the box among us.

usage.p: 用法说明
among, between
1 如果遇到一伙、一群(三个及三个以上)而并不分别看待其中的各个成份，我们就要用among,例如：
We found a little house hidden among the trees.我们发现树丛之中遮掩着一所小房子
2 divide 和share 之类的词，后接复数名词时，既可以用among 也可以用between。
The millionaire divided his wealth among (或between) his sons and daughters.那位百万富翁把财产分给了儿女们。
3 among 可以用来表示“之一”、“其中有些”、或“其中包括”。
Among the first to arrive was the Fantasian ambassador.最先到来的人们当中就有那位所谓的“大使”。
4 与 among 不同的是，between指在二个人或物之间，用于二个以上的人或物时，表示并没有逐一单个来看。
Between them they soon finished the work.他们大家一齐动手，不久就完成了任务。
5 between 可用来表示“由于…与…”，既可说明双重原因，亦可说明多重原因，因此，后接名词可以是二个，也可以是三个以上，例如：
Between the noise outside and the cries of the baby inside,I just cannot concentrate on my writing.屋外的噪声和屋内的孩子的哭声简直使我无法专心写作。

sense.description: 道德范畴以外的；无道德原则可言的
表示情爱的，感觉情爱的，与情爱有关的
(靠定期攒钱而)逐步清还(债务)

usage.p: 用法说明
amount
amount 表示“一定数额”或“一定数量”，后接不可数名词(通常指不可分的东西或抽象的事物)。
amount有时可用复数形式；此时，需注意主谓一致问题。
Large amounts of money were saved.节省了大笔大笔的开支。
A sufficient amount of flour was needed.需要足够数量的面粉。
另外，amount 前面可以用large 或small来修饰，但不用big或little。

usage.p: 用法说明
and
and 可以用来连接语法作用相同的词语。当这类词语超过两个时，通常把and 放在最后一个词语之前，例如：
bread and butter面包和黄油
bread,butter and cheese面包、黄油和奶酪
用and连接的同类词语，通常较短的词语放在前面，例如：
big and ugly 又大又难看
cup and saucer 茶杯和茶碟
但有些用and连接的常用词语，次序是固定的，不能改变，例如：
hands and knees 趴在地上
fish and chips 炸鱼加炸土豆条儿
非正式英语中，try,wait 等动词与其它动词连用时，往往不用动词不定式而是后接and 这一结构只能用于这些动词的原形，例如：
Try and get some unsalted butter.想法弄点淡黄油来。(但不能说I tried and got...) Let's wait and see.咱们等着瞧吧。(但不能说We waited and saw...)

usage.p: 用法说明
answer,reply

这两个词都可以表示“回答”，但在适用场合与句法方面都有较为明显的差别。answer 更为常用，使用范围更广；既可作及物动词又可作不及物动词，表示以书面或口头方式作“回答”。而reply则常用于较为正式的场合或作出较正式的答复，含有针对别人的观点，经过周密思考后回答之义，常作不及物动词。因此，answer her letter侧重写回信，说明已收到来信，回信内容并不一定重要；而reply to her letter 则侧重回信内容，对来信中提到的各点逐一作出答复，有较强的针对性。

sense.description: (用于疑问句、否定句或if从句)任何人

usage.p: 用法说明
anyone
anyone既可以泛指“所有的人，任何人”，又可以指某一特定种类中的每个人。
Is there anyone in the room?屋里有人吗？
If anyone asks where you are, I'll say you have just gone out.谁打听你的下落，我都说你刚出去。
anyone不同于any one,后者的意思是“所选择的任何一个(人或物)”。
You may open any one of the three boxes.你可以打开这三具盒子当中的任何一个。

example.source: You can take anything you like.
example.target: 你可以拿任何你喜欢的东西。

example.source: He'll surely do anything for you.
example.target: 他必定会为你做任何事。

sense.description: (用于疑问句、否定句或if从句)任何东西都(不)

example.source: Do you want anything to drink?

example.target: 别相信他说的任何一句话。
我什么都干，唯独不干那件事。

example.source: He was anything but a writer.
Is my idea anything like yours?
example.target: 我的想法和你多少有点相像吗？

example.source: We have not anything like completed the task.
example.target: 我们还远远没有完成这项任务。

example.source: Have you seen anything of a little black dog?
Is she anything of a star?
example.target: 她是不是有点儿明星的味道？

example.source: His family, if anything, is richer than mine.
example.target: 如果有区别的话，那就是他家比我家更富裕。

example.source: I'm not proud of her. If anything, I'm ashamed.
example.target: 我并不为她感到骄傲，正相反，我感到羞耻。

example.source: They ran like anything to get away.
example.target: 为了逃脱，他们拼命奔跑。

example.source: You are not suffering from any peculiar disease or anything.
example.target: 你没有患上任何怪病，也没有其他什么问题。

example.source: I am going anyway, no matter what you say.
example.target: 不管你怎么说，我都要去。

usage.p: 用法说明
anyway, any way
anyway通常表示“前面所说的话无关紧要”或“不管怎样”。
I can't remember when Shakespeare died.Perhaps it was 1614 or 1615-anyway,I know it was around then.莎士比亚是什么时候逝世的，我不记得了，可能是1614年，也可能是1615年。反正，我知道就在那前后。
She wasn't very polite,but anyway,I offered her a hand.她不够礼貌，但不管怎样，我还是帮了她一把。
用于句末时，表示“无论如何”。
...,I'll do it anyway...无论如何，我都会去做的。
anyway 与(in)any way 不同。后者相当于by any method,意思是“在任何方面，用任何方法”或“往任何方向”。
He never threatened her in any way.他从来没有以任何方式对她进行过威胁。

example.source: You can sit anywhere you like.
example.target: 你喜欢坐哪里，就坐哪里。

sense.description: (用于疑问句、否定句或if从句)在任何地方；什么地方

example.source: If you go anywhere, take me with you.
example.target: 你如果要去哪儿，带我一起去。
我在哪儿都找不到这东西。

example.source: It's a weak argument, not anywhere good enough.
example.target: 这是一个没有说服力的论据，压根儿没用。

example.source: He lived apart from his parents.
They planted the trees two meters apart.
example.target: 他们每隔两米种一棵树。

example.source: The fires broke out a few hours apart.

usage.p: 用法说明
apprehend, comprehend
apprehend意思是“领会”，“知晓”或“认识某事物的存在”；而comprehend则表示从思想上掌握，彻底理解，强调所包含的思维过程，试比较：

usage.p: 用法说明
area, region, district
这三个词都可以表示地球表面的某个部分。area 最为通用，所指范围可大可小，并非固定的地区；region通常指较大的范围，一般指某个国家的一部分，可以是也可以不是固定的地区；而district所指范围比region小，通常是一个国家或一个城市的固定区域，例如：
I find the people in this area very hospitable.我发现这一带的居民很好客。
This is the most densely populated region in the country.这是该国人口最稠密的地区。
We live in different school districts.我们住在不同的校区。

usage.p: 用法说明
arise, rise
arise 表示“开始”、“显现”或“受到注意”时，主语大都为抽象名词。
A discussion arose about the best way to pay.一个关于最好以什么方式付款的讨论开始了。
I'm afraid a difficulty has arisen.恐怕有困难产生了。
rise 的意思是“上升”或起身(相当于口语中的get up)
The sun has risen.太阳已经升起来了。
She rose and left the room.她站起身来，走出了房间。
He woke at dawn but didn't rise at once.黎明时他就醒了，但没有马上起床。

usage.p: 用法说明
around, round, about
这三个词都有“围绕”的意思，但含义和用法不尽相同，需要注意以下几点：
1 当描述环形动作或曲线运动，表示“围绕”时，英国英语多用round，而美国英语用around居多，例如：
round/around the corner拐角处
turn round/around转身
round/around the day 一整天
round/around the table 围着桌子
2 表示把东西分发给一伙人中的每一个人或是到某地的各处，英国人用round，而美国人用around,例如：
Hand round/around the papers.把文件散发一下。
Just look round / around on campus.在校园里逛一逛吧。
3 用来指不很明确或不很确定的运动或位置，表示“不止一处”、“在许多地方”时，可用around, round, about,但在美国英语中一般只用around，例如：
wandering around/round/about到处游荡
stand around/round/about在各处站着
4 美国英语中的 around和英国英语中的about一样，可以用于短语动词当中，描述无聊，不成系统、浪费时间或是无意义的活动，例如：
Stop fooling around/about.别瞎耽搁时间了。
5 around 和about可用来表示“大约”，“不精确”。英国英语在表示时间的词组里，也可用round。例如：
There are around/about thirty people here.这里大约有30人。
It costs around/about two hundred.大约要花200块钱。
I'll be back around/round/about lunch-time.我午饭前后回来。

example.source: We aroused him from(或out of)his deep sleep.

usage.p: 用法说明
arouse, rouse
arouse多用于抽象含义，宾语往往是抽象的词(如curiosity/suspicion/sympathy等)，例如：
arouse one's interest in...引起某人对…的兴趣
rouse的宾语是人，意思是当人们睡觉、厌倦或缺乏热情时，将其唤醒或使之振奋。
In the morning,the sleeping children were roused by their parents.早晨，在睡梦中的孩子被父母叫醒。
The speech of a successful orator will surely rouse his audience.成功的演讲者当然会用自己的言语使听众们振奋起来。

usage.p: 用法说明
as
1 说明人与人、东西与东西、动作与动作、状态与状态之间有相似之处时，as是连词，后面跟从句(正式文体中有时跟问句的词序和结构)或介词词组。
I fear dogs,as does my father.跟我父亲一样，我也怕狗。
In 1939,as in 1914,everybody wanted war.在1939年，和在1914年一样，每个人都希望打仗。
在非正式美国英语中，like常用作连词，以代替as,例如：
I cannot speak French like he does.我说法语不像他那样好。
这种用法在英国英语里也普遍起来。但要注意的是，无论是美国英语还是英国英语，在正式文体中，人们还是认为这种用法是“不正确的”。
2 如果要谈论同时发生的事情或同时存在的情况，可以使用as,when或while;如果表示两个短促动作或事件同时发生，最常用的是as或just as (也可以用when),例如：
Just as he caught the ball there was a tearing sound.他把球抓住时，听到了一种撕裂的声音。
3 谈论两个同时进行的动作(或者事件、情况)时，可以用as 来说明两种正在发展或变化的情况，例如：
As I get older I get more optimistic.我越活越乐观。

usage.p: 用法说明
assume, presume, suppose
这三个词都可作“假定”、“假设”解，表示认为某事是真的或可能的，但在含义上仍有较大差别。assume表示在证据不足或对某一看法尚存异议的情况下的“假设”，认为某事是可能的，含有较强的成份，例如：
I assumed that they were able to com-plete the project.我设想他们能完成这个项目。
presume指在某种经验或理由的基础上进行“假想”，认为某事可能是事实；或虽无法直接证明，但仍然有较肯定的因素。然而“假想”可能是错的。例如：
When I found the dormitory empty, I presumed that my roommates had gone home.当我发现宿舍空无一人时，我想我的室友们都已回家去了。
suppose含义较广，可表示有一定根据的“假设”，在此意义上与presume接近，但suppose侧重表示对未来事物的“假定”，含有如果发生某种情况之义。例如：
I supposed mistakenly,that she already knew the truth.我错误地认为，她已知道了事情的真相。
Suppose it rains,what shall I do?假如下雨了，我该怎么办？

example.source: We are working on the assumption that the task will be finished at the end of this month.
example.target: 我们在假定在月底能够完成这项任务。

example.source: I was under the assumption that he would come back soon.

example.target: 我们对赢得比赛胸有成竹。

example.source: He spoke in a tone of assurance.
example.target: 他讲话的口气非常有把握。

example.source: He gave me his assurance that he would come.
Despite repeated assurances, he failed to repay the money he had borrowed.
example.target: 尽管他再三保证，但是借去的钱却始终没还。

example.source: She assured us that everything would be all right.
example.target: 她向我们保证一切都会好起来。

example.source: I assure you they'll be safe with us.
example.target: 我向你保证，他们和我们在一起很安全。

example.source: I was able to assure myself that nothing had been taken from my handbag.
example.target: 我确信手提包里没有被拿走什么东西。

example.source: His success as an actor was now assured.
example.target: 他当演员很成功，这一点已经毋庸置疑了。

example.source: She assured her life with this company.
example.target: 她向这家公司保了人寿险。

usage.p: 用法说明
assure, ensure, guarantee
这三个词都表示“保证”，但侧重点不同。
assure通常表示向某人“保证”，强调让对方放心；ensure侧重在设法或采取措施“保证”某事能够成功；而guarantee则含有较强的允诺之义，侧重表示在提供服务、付款、质量等方面作出“担保”。试比较：
We should assure them of their safety.我们应当向他们讲明，他们不会出事。
We should ensure their safety.我们应(采取措施)确保他们的安全。
We must guarantee their safety,otherwise they won't do it.我们必须作出承诺，否则他们就不干了。

example.target: 成功属于努力工作的人们。

example.source: I was still wide awake despite the lateness of the day.
example.target: 尽管夜已深了，我仍毫无睡意。

example.source: We haven't been fully awake to difficulties.
example.target: 我们还没有充分意识到困难。

example.source: I awoke when he entered the room.
The memories awoke in me when I heard the song.
example.target: 我听到那首歌时往事涌上心头。
我那逐渐淡薄的兴趣重被激起。
她把睡熟的孩子弄醒了。
那景像又勾起了往日的恐惧。
她的话激起了我的愤怒。
他说的事引起了我的兴趣。

example.source: I was awakened by a loud noise.
We must awaken them to the difficulties facing us.
example.target: 我们必须使他们认识到我们所面临的困难。

example.source: I awakened to find he had gone.
example.target: 我醒来发现他已经走了。

example.source: I have awakened to the fact.
example.target: 我已经认识到这一事实。

example.source: The discovery that her husband was unfaithful to her was a rude awakening.
example.target: 她发觉丈夫对自己不忠而猛地惊醒。

example.source: Einstein was awarded the Nobel Prize for his great devotion to physics.
example.target: 爱因斯坦因其在物理学方面做出的巨大贡献而被授予诺贝尔奖。

example.source: The school awarded scholarships to needy students.
example.target: 学校给予贫困学生奖学金。

example.source: The court awarded him damages of $50,000.
example.target: 法庭判给他5万美元损害赔偿费。

example.source: Most smokers are perfectly aware of the danger of smoking.
example.target: 大多数吸烟者都十分清楚吸烟的危害。

example.source: It happened without my being aware of it.
example.target: 事情在我不知不觉中发生了。

example.source: He's a politically aware young man.
example.target: 他是个政治上有觉悟的年轻人。

example.source: The deck was awash in the storm.
example.target: 甲板在暴风雨中被海水漫过。

example.source: TV programme nowadays is awash with soap operas.
example.target: 现如今电视节目满是肥皂剧。

example.source: I swam away from the shore.
The shop is a few minutes walk away.
example.target: 商店离这里有几分钟的步行距离。

example.source: Christmas is only a week away.
example.target: 离圣诞节只有一个星期了。

example.source: We looked in awe upon him.
example.target: 我们以敬畏的目光望着他。

example.source: The church is so imposing that it inspires awe.
example.target: 这座教堂雄伟得令人惊叹。

phrase.word: stand in awe of sb.(或be in awe of sb.)

example.source: The soldiers stood in awe of the general.
The students were awed into silence by the sternness of her voice.
example.target: 她严厉的声音把学生们吓得鸦雀无声。

example.source: The majesty of the moun-tains awed us.
example.target: 高山的雄伟气势使我们惊叹。

sense.description: 使人敬畏的；令人惊叹的
极坏的；极讨厌的；极难看的

example.target: 他是个非常惹人讨厌的家伙。

example.source: She had an awful bad cold.
example.target: 她得了十分厉害的感冒。

example.source: He won't be leaving yet awhile.
The young man feels awkward with girls.
example.target: 那个小伙子在女孩们面前感到局促不安。

example.source: Tomorrow is rather awkward for him.
I was in a very awkward position.
Swans are surprisingly awkward on land.
example.target: 天鹅在陆地上笨得出奇。

example.source: He's been AWOL for a week.
example.target: 他已经擅自离开一周之久了。

example.source: I have no axe to grind over this matter.
example.target: 在这件事情上我没有私心。

phrase.word: a man with political axes to grind

sense.description: 一个在政治上有个人打算的人

example.source: Our plan of building a new school got the axe from the government.
example.target: 政府取消了我们兴建新学校的计划。

example.source: His boss gave him the axe last weekend.
example.target: 他的老板上周末把他解雇了。

example.source: Student grants are to be axed next year.
example.target: 学生的补助金明年将大大削减。

sense.description: 轴线(将均匀的图形分成两个对称的部分的直线)

example.source: The axis of a circle is its diameter.

sense.description: (伊朗穆斯林宗教领袖)阿亚图拉
(海员等回答上级命令时说)明白；原来如此
天蓝色的；浅蓝色的；蔚蓝色的
